messages.message: Also overall, the movement process is quite difficult and prone to error. Since after you move the field, you have to relocate to the new position where you can move the field from. This leads to a slow process when you need to move a fields more than 1/2 locations. Can we make this process a drag and drop to avoid this issue?
can you explain why we didn’t implement a drag-and-drop UI here? @CJ @Natasha
iirc it was because there wasn't a good place to put a drag handle affordance
i suppose we could in theory not have a drag handle
yeah i think that if we have the up/down buttons, people will try to drag and drop as well to move things faster, so a drag handle is not strictly necessary
We’ve received this feedback before - we should absolutely move to drag (adding in @Kaustubh (KD) )

I've actually had this same though, but wasn't sure if we were getting much feedback. This is one of those things that I see can be tricky if you have many fields that require scrolling (as you drag), but its also such an established pattern. cc: @Natasha + @Jianqi Xing since this might have come up during the feedback sessions
@Tom Murphy if you haven't created a ticket already let me know. Will create one
